2.text: Also—to-day is my complaint bitter, My hand hath been heavy because of my sighing.

3.text: O that I had known—and I find Him, I come in unto His seat,

4.text: I arrange before Him the cause, And my mouth fill with arguments.

5.text: I know the words He doth answer me, And understand what He saith to me.

6.text: In the abundance of power doth He strive with me? No! surely He putteth it in me.

7.text: There the upright doth reason with Him, And I escape for ever from my judge.

8.text: Lo, forward I go—and He is not, And backward—and I perceive him not.

9.text: To the left in His working—and I see not, He is covered on the right, and I behold not.

10.text: For He hath known the way with me, He hath tried me—as gold I go forth.

11.text: On His step hath my foot laid hold, His way I have kept, and turn not aside,

12.text: The command of His lips, and I depart not. Above my allotted portion I have laid up The sayings of His mouth.

13.text: And He is in one mind, And who doth turn Him back? And His soul hath desired—and He doth it.

14.text: For He doth complete my portion, And many such things are with Him.

15.text: Therefore, from His presence I am troubled, I consider, and am afraid of Him.

16.text: And God hath made my heart soft, And the Mighty hath troubled me.

17.text: For I have not been cut off before darkness, And before me He covered thick darkness.
